pullRequest.body:
This PR shows a few facts related to `Monoid.exponent`, especially when it is prime:

1. A nontrivial finite cancellative monoid has exponent greater than 1.
2. A nontrivial monoid has prime exponent `p` if and only if every non-identity element has order `p`.
3. A group of order `p ^ 2` with `p` prime is not cyclic if and only if it has exponent `p`.

---

nodes.body: I also have a doubt: is a finite cancellative monoid actually a group?

> I also have a doubt: is a finite cancellative monoid actually a group?

Ah yes, indeed, by the standard argument: by pigeonhole, there are `m n : â„•` with `m < n` such that `g ^ n = g ^ m`, and by cancellation, `g ^ (n - m) = 1`. I'll update the PR.

Except my comment about the need of `Group` (it seems to me that `Monoid` is enough), LGTM, thanks!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Â· simpa [h g hg] using pow_orderOf_eq_one g ```
If all goes as planned, #8722 will make `not_isAddCyclic_iff_exponent_eq_prime` the `to_additivized` name of this lemma!

Tao's PFR project introduces an [ElementaryAddCommGroup](https://github.com/teorth/pfr/blob/245ee1eb12a39ba36299812f0ba11557b673fc41/PFR/f2_vec.lean#L21-L22) class, and it would be nice to show it [must be the case](https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/212084/group-with-order-p2-must-be-abelian-how-to-prove-that) here. cc @tb65536
@alreadydone, moogle suggests [docs#IsPGroup.commGroupOfCardEqPrimeSq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/PGroup.html#IsPGroup.commGroupOfCardEqPrimeSq).
Nice, thanks!
The `to_additive` PR has been merged: if you merge the new master, this error should disappear!
Do you really need `Group` here?

Yes. The issue is that you need cancellation, for otherwise the exponent could be zero. And as pointed out above, a finite (left- or right-) cancellative monoid is a group. Just to drive home the point, any nontrivial `MonoidWithZero` has exponent zero.
```lean
import Mathlib.GroupTheory.Exponent

example {M : Type*} [MonoidWithZero M] [Nontrivial M] :
    Monoid.exponent M = 0 := by
  rw [@Monoid.exponent_eq_zero_iff, Monoid.ExponentExists]
  push_neg
  exact fun n hn â†¦ âŸ¨0, by simp [zero_pow hn]âŸ©
```
